Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Chimera C3 (hybrid peptide of hBD2 and hBD3; synthetic AMPs, 3S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (74.47%) tohBD2at the N-terminus and 60.42% similarity to hBD-3.   K: 17%; V=A=S: 14%. GRAVY: -0.27; M Wt: 4972.047; M formula: C219H359N65O54S6, mol ex coeff: 4845.Activity: active against both E. coli (MBC 0.1 ug/ml) and S. aureus (MBC 0.78 ug/ml) better than either hBD2 or hBD3.  Also active against K. pneumoniae CF1 ESBL (MBC 0.39-3.13 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MBC 1.56 ug/ml), E. faecalis ATCC 51299 (MBC 0.78 ug/ml) anti-VRE, E. faecium 4 strains (MBC 0.78-1.56 ug/ml), S. aureus MRSA (MBC 0.78 ug/ml), and C. albicans 5 strains (MBC 12.5-50 ug/ml). Anaerobic bacteria: B. fragilis ATCC 25285 (MBC 6.25 ug/ml), C.perfringens ATCC 13124 (MBC >100 ug/ml), P. anaerobius ATCC 27337 (MBC 50 ug/ml), P. acnes ATCC 6919 (MBC 1.56 ug/ml), and P. oralis ATCC 33321 (MBC > 100 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-sensitive:E. coli (150 mM); NaCl-sensitive:S. aureus (150 mM).
Literature Information.Author: Jung S, Mysliwy J, Spudy B, Lorenzen I, Reiss K, Gelhaus C, Podschun R, Leippe M, Gr√∂tzinger J. 2011
Literature Information.Title: Human beta-defensin 2 and beta-defensin 3 chimeric peptides reveal the structural basis of the pathogen specificity of their parent molecules.
